body: And that's a 200 response code then, right?
Yep, sorry, it's a 200.

issue.title: cmd/syncthing: Return 500 with an error object instead of empty 200 on marshalling error in REST response

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

If we pass an invalid object to sendJSON, it'll silently write an empty 200 response. With this change we should return a 500 with an `{"error": "something"}` in it instead. I think.
### Testing

None whatsoever as I can't reproduce an error here right now. Lets have canton7 see if he can get something from this in #2854 before merging.

body:
See what this one returns instead, if you can reproduce it?

http://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-pr/1640/
I can't repro, but I've asked @scienmind, who can, to give it a shot.
The link above gives 404...
https://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-windows/142/ should have it.

Got it.
Should I expect "no crashing" or "better logging" to tackle the issue?

It should crash, but in a slightly different way.

The log entries created by SyncTrayzor around the time of the crash should provide enough information to investigate the issue.
Weirdly I can't reproduce it this time. The crash usually happens during program's startup, so I've been doing SyncTrayzor's restarts for quite a while, didn't crash so far.
@calmh do you actually return 500 there...?

Do now, yes, if the same thing as previously happens, I'm pretty sure. Note thought that the current master is somewhat diverged from v0.12.20 so there might be other things that make it not happen - like the database starting up faster or whatever...
Ah, yeah I see it.
Another crash, log at: https://github.com/canton7/SyncTrayzor/issues/231
Argh I linked you to a bad build.... Sorry. I'll let @calmh tell you what to download :stuck_out_tongue_closed_eyes:
The patch is only in latest master, which is no longer compatible with v0.12. Do we need a backport of that maybe?

I think it would depend on how far away 0.13 is, and how painful the transition to it from 0.12 will be.
If it's "around the corner" (i.e. couple of weeks), and the upgrade from 0.12 is smooth and not breaking, then I assume we can let 0.13 "fix it". 

Otherwise, maybe we should backport...
It'll not fix it though, just give canton7 more info, so he can tell us, and we can fix whatever it really is :) I'll build a v0.12.20+this, hang on.
Here: https://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-branch/235/artifact/

body: Can we apply that to the v0.12 branch, and release it next time around? People are seeing this, but sporadically, so we're missing opportunities to see what's actually wrong.
Yep, it's in v0.12.21 :)
